citation: Proclamation under the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the Roads and Jetties Act 1935

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, by this my proclamation made under section 52A of the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 , declare –

        (a) those parts of the Bridport Main Road specified in Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be limited access roads; and
        (b) the places specified in Schedule 2 to this proclamation to be the places of access for the purposes of section 52B of that Act; and
        (c) that this proclamation takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.
23 December 1998

G. S. M. GREEN

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

P. A. LENNON

Minister for Infrastructure, Energy and Resouces

SCHEDULE 1 - Bridport Main Road Limited Access Roads

Definition  Length in kilometres  Those parts of the Bridport Main Road:      (a)  from the eastern bank of Pipers River to a point 4.31 kilometres east of Dalrymple Road (approximately 0.40 kilometres west of Lefroy Road), as shown bounded by heavy black lines on Plan Nos. 4096, 4235 and 4298 in the Central Plan Register;  9.14    (b)  from a point 0.53 kilometres east of Dalrymple Road to its junction with the East Tamar Highway, as shown bounded by heavy black lines on Plan Nos. 4299, 4300 and 4301 in the Central Plan Register.  7.55
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              


SCHEDULE 2 - Places of Access

  Description  Location      Distance in kilometres west of eastern abutment of Pipers River Bridge  1.  Weymouth Road – north side  1.54  2.  School Road – south side  1.54  3.  Back Creek Road – north side  2.70  4.  Pipers River Secondary Road – south side  2.70  5.  Industry Road – south side  3.69  6.  Troopers Track – south side  7.20  7.  Lefroy Road – north side  8.74  8.  Dalrymple Road – south side  13.51  9.  Atkins Road – south side  16.89  10.  Access Road – north side  18.99
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             


Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 30 December 1998

This proclamation is administered in the Department of Infrastructure, Energy and Resources.
